subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Saturday, 23 June, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Arsenal announce Henry departure
Arsenal confirm they have reached an agreement with Barcelona for the transfer of striker Thierry Henry.



 
Eriksson set to take Man City job
Sven-Goran Eriksson is close to agreeing to become Manchester City manager, BBC Sport understands.



 
Donati poised for Celtic switch
AC Milan holding midfielder Massimo Donati will move to Celtic in a £3m deal should he pass a medical.








GOLF




Fasth struggles but retains lead
Niclas Fasth shares the lead with Portugal's Jose-Filipe Lima going into the final round of the BMW International Open.



 
Travelers Ch'ship leaderboard
Leading scores from the PGA tournament.



 
BMW International leaderboard
The third round is underway at the European Tour's BMW International Open in Munich.








MOTORSPORT




Edwards snatches Donington pole
American Colin Edwards seizes pole position from Yamaha team-mate Valentino Rossi at the British Grand Prix.



 
Ferrari wait for 'real Raikkonen'
Ferrari president Luca di Montezemolo says they are still waiting for Kimi Raikkonen to produce his best form.



 
Stoner slams 'slippery' Donington
MotoGP championship leader Casey Stoner says going round Donington in the wet is like 'riding on grease'.








FORMULA ONE




Ferrari wait for 'real Raikkonen'
Ferrari president Luca di Montezemolo says they are still waiting for Kimi Raikkonen to produce his best form.



 
Hamilton - I can hold off Alonso
Lewis Hamilton believes he has a competitive edge over Fernando Alonso that could see him crowned F1 champion.



 
Ferrari 'can regain early form'
Ferrari president Luca di Montezemolo claims there is little to choose between his team and McLaren despite their big lead in the F1 standings.








ATHLETICS




Superb Pickering leads GB charge
Craig Pickering wins the 100m to leave Britain's men in fourth place at the European Cup.



 
Gay throws down sprint gauntlet
Tyson Gay runs the fastest 100m in the world this year, clocking 9.84 seconds at the US Championships.



 
Pickering leads GB's Euro hopes
Sprinter Craig Pickering aims to inspire Great Britain's men's team to another European Cup win in Munich this weekend.








CYCLING




British pair close on Tour spot
British riders Mark Cavendish and Roger Hammond are named in T-Mobile's initial squad of 13 riders for the Tour de France.



 
Scene set for Smithfield Nocturne
Top-class criterium racing is back in the heart of London on Saturday as the city gears up for the Tour de France.



 
Cavendish backs anti-doping drive
Britain's Mark Cavendish signs the International Cycling Union's new anti-doping charter.








FUN AND GAMES




Dutch courage
Robbo has the answer to why England never win penalty shoot-outs



 
Ten to Tackle
How much can you remember about the past week's sport?



 
Angel delight
Robbo on why it cheers him to see out-of-shape sportsmen winning trophies
